name: Sharpee: TypeScript Interactive Fiction Authoring Platform

chat_messages.text:
I'm working on Sharpee, a TypeScript-based Interactive Fiction authoring platform. 
Project location: C:\repotemp\sharpee (accessible via MCP)
We recently pivoted from an over-engineered approach to an IF-first design. Current status:
- ‚úÖ Core architecture (channels, events) - keeping these
- ‚úÖ New IF-specific parser with pattern matching and disambiguation 
- üöß Need to simplify world model with IF-specific concepts
- ‚è≥ Need to implement the Forge authoring layer
IMPORTANT: Claude Desktop has a bug that erases conversations. To work around this:
1. FIRST, create a file status-check-[timestamp].md documenting what you find
2. Check these areas and add findings to the status file after EACH check:
   - packages/core/src/world-model/ for any new IF-specific files
   - Any new test files for world model
   - ROADMAP.md for updates
   - Any status files after May 22, 2025
   - Look for TODO files or partial implementations
3. After EACH section you check, immediately update the status file with your findings
4. Only after you've written everything to the status file, provide a summary
Do not start any implementation work - just investigate and document.
Key project goals for reference:
- Fluent API for non-programmer authors
- Graph-based world model with IF-specific concepts
- Separate text emission from game logic  
- Multi-language support
- Pattern-based parser (not NLP)

content.text:
I'm working on Sharpee, a TypeScript-based Interactive Fiction authoring platform. 
Project location: C:\repotemp\sharpee (accessible via MCP)
We recently pivoted from an over-engineered approach to an IF-first design. Current status:
- ‚úÖ Core architecture (channels, events) - keeping these
- ‚úÖ New IF-specific parser with pattern matching and disambiguation 
- üöß Need to simplify world model with IF-specific concepts
- ‚è≥ Need to implement the Forge authoring layer
IMPORTANT: Claude Desktop has a bug that erases conversations. To work around this:
1. FIRST, create a file status-check-[timestamp].md documenting what you find
2. Check these areas and add findings to the status file after EACH check:
   - packages/core/src/world-model/ for any new IF-specific files
   - Any new test files for world model
   - ROADMAP.md for updates
   - Any status files after May 22, 2025
   - Look for TODO files or partial implementations
3. After EACH section you check, immediately update the status file with your findings
4. Only after you've written everything to the status file, provide a summary
Do not start any implementation work - just investigate and document.
Key project goals for reference:
- Fluent API for non-programmer authors
- Graph-based world model with IF-specific concepts
- Separate text emission from game logic  
- Multi-language support
- Pattern-based parser (not NLP)
